instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no video
threads.message:
Liquid Damaged board, around SMC, <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> destroyed. 

-Reballed SMC, replaced <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>, added fresh solder to all resistor in the area, 
-Green light, then orange light. 
-<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3V
-All big coils have voltage
-<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>: 3.34V
-<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 0V (not shorted to ground)

Any help?

Gracias

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no video
threads.message:
Issue found thanks to your last comment
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>: 0V

Trace from <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> to PIN 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> was broken.

Trace restored and board is working. 

Gracias V
